TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit WebApiAuthenticationBuilderExtensions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Extensions for AuthenticationBuilder for startup initialization of Web APIs.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.AuthenticationBuilder AddProtectedWebApi (this Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.AuthenticationBuilder builder, Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration configuration, string configSectionName = "AzureAd", string jwtBearerScheme = "Bearer", System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 tokenDecryptionCertificate = default, bool subscribeToJwtBearerMiddlewareDiagnosticsEvents = false);

<Extension()> Public Function AddProtectedWebApi (builder As AuthenticationBuilder, configuration As IConfiguration, Optional configSectionName As String = "AzureAd", Optional jwtBearerScheme As String = "Bearer", Optional tokenDecryptionCertificate As X509Certificate2 = null, Optional subscribeToJwtBearerMiddlewareDiagnosticsEvents As Boolean = false) As AuthenticationBuilder

static member AddProtectedWebApi : Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.AuthenticationBuilder * Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration * string * string * System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 * bool -> Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.AuthenticationBuilder

Docs.param: AuthenticationBuilder to which to add this configuration
The configuration section with the necessary settings to initialize authentication options
The JwtBearer scheme name to be used. By default it uses "Bearer"
Set to true if you want to debug, or just understand the JwtBearer events.
Docs.summary: Protects the Web API with Microsoft identity platform (formerly Azure AD v2.0) This method expects the configuration file will have a section, named "AzureAd" as default, with the necessary settings to initialize authentication options.
